Kolumna Dejana Vodovnika: Minister opozarja!
Kaj če bi grozne fotke o nevarnosti pretirane uporabe mobilcev na nepravih mestih dodali na škatle fensi telefonov?
07 Nov 2019, 21:25 by Dejan Vodovnik
Ob dvanajstletnici prepovedi kajenja v zaprtih javnih in delovnih prostorih ni bilo ognjemetov, so pa zato številni že pozabili, kako je bilo ob desetletnici, ko so nekateri slavili, kot se temu reče, delavno. Veselili so se pomembnega preboja: od takrat morajo namreč uvozniki na zavitke tobaka lepiti fotografije iznakaženih obrazov in predvsem zob, osmojenih pljuč itd. Dotakratna opozorila, da je kajenje škodljivo, pač niso zadostovala več.Nihče ne ve, ali so s podobami razkrajajočih se organov na cigaretnih škatlicah t. i. kadilski inkvizitorji zadovoljni ali ne. Njih nerganje je še vedno mogoče slišati z različnih koncev in krajev, saj je kajenje še kar ena od sodobnih zdravstvenih pasti.Sodobna past je tudi dejstvo, da je na naših cestah voznikov, ki med vožnjo telefonirajo, kolesarjev s slušalkami v ušesih in pešcev, ki z neprestanim buljenjem v telefon po pločnikih, kolesarskih stezah in tudi po cestah hodijo kot kura brez glave, vse več. Toliko, da jih je zdaj že na radijskih prometnih obvestilih treba opozarjati, da je telefoniranje med vožnjo nevarno. Žalostno, vendar resnično!Vprašanje je, kje so zdaj vse aktualno politične tercijalke in razni spreobrnjeni pobožnjakarji, ki so pred leti zahtevali in uspeli s podobami razkrajajočih se organov na cigaretnih škatlicah? Bil bi namreč pravšnji čas, da se tako kot pred časom kadilski zdaj pojavijo mobitel inkvizitorji in zahtevajo, da bi v številnih oglasih, ki ponujajo najboljše in najbolj fensi mobilne telefone, podobno kot v oglasih za alkohol, ministri za zdravje, tehnologijo, promet … opozorili, da telefoniranje med vožnjo ali pretirana raba telefona in slušalk ter pretirano buljenje v ekrančke na kolesarski stezi ali ulici ubija. Navsezadnje je tudi prometnih nesreč zaradi uporabe telefona med vožnjo, poškodb zaradi telefoniranja med kolesarjenjem in podobno vse več.Kaj če bi opozorila o nevarnosti pretirane uporabe mobilcev na nepravih mestih res napisali na škatle telefonov? In res dodali grozne fotke! S truplom s slušalkami v ušesih in fensi mobitelom v rokah?Ah, to pa ne! So lobiji premočni. Navsezadnje tudi ministrov brez telefona v roki še nisem videl!

Dejan Vodovnik's column: Minister warns!
What if horrible photos of the danger of overuse of mobile phones in the wrong places were added to the boxes of fancy phones?
07 Nov 2019, 21:25 by Dejan Vodovnik
On the twentieth anniversary of the ban on smoking indoors and in workplaces, there were no fireworks, but many have already forgotten how it was on the tenth anniversary when some celebrated, as they say, working. They were looking forward to an important breakthrough: since then, importers have to glue photos of disfigured faces and, above all, teeth, emaciated lungs, etc. onto tobacco wrappers. Repeated warnings that smoking was harmful, they were no longer sufficient. No one knows if the images of decomposing organs are on cigarette boxes t. i. smokers inquisitors satisfied or not. Nursing can still be heard from different places and places, because smoking is another modern health trap. A modern trap is also the fact that on our roads there are drivers on the phone, riders with earphones and pedestrians, constantly staring at the sidewalks, bike lanes and even the roads like a headless chick, staring at the phone. So much so that radio traffic announcements now make them aware that making calls while driving is dangerous. The sad, but real question is, where are all the current political tertiaries and various converted devotees who, years ago, sought and succeeded with the images of decomposing organs on cigarette boxes? It would be a good time for smokers to appear as smokers now, demanding that many advertisements offering the best and most fancy mobile phones, similar to those for alcohol, ministers of health, technology, transport, etc. cautioned that telephoning while driving or excessive use of the phone and headphones and excessive staring at screens on the cycle track or street are killing. After all, there are also accidents due to the use of the phone while driving, injuries due to phone calls while cycling, and more. And they really added terrible photos! With a corpse with headphones in its ears and a fancy cell phone in its hands? Ah, that's not it! The lobbies are too strong. After all, I have never seen ministers without a phone in my hand!
